meanings.definition: To control, operate, or manage by means of a computer or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: The factory cybernated its production line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent2: She cybernated the security system to protect the building from intruders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat cybernated the automatic feeder to get extra treats.
meanings.sent4: His mind cybernated with ideas as he worked on the digital project.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by how the robot cybernated the complex calculations instantly.

meanings.sent1: The cybernated car smoothly adjusted its speed based on traffic conditions.
meanings.sent2: The cybernated thermostat regulated the temperature in the house automatically.
meanings.sent3: The cybernated drone flew with precision, capturing stunning aerial footage.
meanings.sent4: Her cybernated watch reminded her to stand up and stretch every hour.
meanings.sent5: The cybernated sprinkler system watered the garden at the perfect time every day.
